page.title: 11Newcastle Town Moor
page.content: The{Newcastle Town Moor}is an invaluable city amenity. It is used all year round for cross country running, cattle grazing and hobbies like model aeroplane flying. A major use is for the{Hoppings,}the largest travelling fair in Europe, which comes to the Moor for a week in June. The Moor is very close to the city centre and is easily accessible. The city council has avoided the temptation to build on the Moor, although the NW section of the{urban {motorway}cuts across the SW corner. The earth excavated for the motorway was used to make two mounds. These hills are ideal for running, and are used for sledging and{skiing}in winter. Sadly, with rising{violence,}its loneliness means muggings are on the increase.
